title: Honor Magic 7 RSR Porsche Design to feature improved 200MP periscope module
description: Honor is launching its Magic7 RSR Porsche Design flagship on Monday, December 23, and it’s expected to go all out on the camera front with a remarkable periscope camera. The brand shared a few teasers on its Weibo profile detailing that the Magic7 RSR will feature a dual electromagnetic focus motor for class-leading focusing and industry-leading aperture size that will capture more light and details in shots. Honor Magic7 RSR Porsche Design periscope sensor specs (machine translated from Chinese) Reliable tipster Digital Chat Station chimed in, revealing the key specs of the...
excerpt: The top-tier Magic7 variant is launching in China on Monday. Honor is launching its Magic7 RSR Porsche Design flagship on Monday, December 23, and it’s...
text: Honor is launching its Magic7 RSR Porsche Design flagship on Monday, December 23, and it’s expected to go all out on the camera front with a remarkable periscope camera. The brand shared a few teasers on its Weibo profile detailing that the Magic7 RSR will feature a dual electromagnetic focus motor for class-leading focusing and industry-leading aperture size that will capture more light and details in shots. Honor Magic7 RSR Porsche Design periscope sensor specs (machine translated from Chinese) Reliable tipster Digital Chat Station chimed in, revealing the key specs of the Magic 7 RSR’s camera setup. As per the tipster, Honor is bringing a 50MP main cam with the OmniVision OV50K sensor – a 1/1.3-inch sensor with a variable f/1.2-2.0 aperture. The main cam will be joined by a 200MP 1/1.4” periscope sensor with f/1.88 aperture, 3x optical and up to 100x digital zoom alongside the aforementioned dual electromagnetic focus motor. The third shooter on the back is a 50MP ultrawide lens with a 122° field of view and 2.5cm macro mode capabilities. These camera specs are nearly identical to the Honor Magic7 Pro, which launched in China back in October, but the changes in the periscope module could deliver even better light capture and focusing capabilities. Source 1 • Source 2 (both in Chinese)
html:
Honor is launching its Magic7 RSR Porsche Design flagship on Monday, December 23, and it’s expected to go all out on the camera front with a remarkable periscope camera. The brand shared a few teasers on its Weibo profile detailing that the Magic7 RSR will feature a dual electromagnetic focus motor for class-leading focusing and industry-leading aperture size that will capture more light and details in shots.


Honor Magic7 RSR Porsche Design periscope sensor specs (machine translated from Chinese)

Reliable tipster Digital Chat Station chimed in, revealing the key specs of the Magic 7 RSR’s camera setup. As per the tipster, Honor is bringing a 50MP main cam with the OmniVision OV50K sensor – a 1/1.3-inch sensor with a variable f/1.2-2.0 aperture.

The main cam will be joined by a 200MP 1/1.4” periscope sensor with f/1.88 aperture, 3x optical and up to 100x digital zoom alongside the aforementioned dual electromagnetic focus motor. The third shooter on the back is a 50MP ultrawide lens with a 122° field of view and 2.5cm macro mode capabilities.

These camera specs are nearly identical to the Honor Magic7 Pro, which launched in China back in October, but the changes in the periscope module could deliver even better light capture and focusing capabilities.

Source 1 • Source 2 (both in Chinese)
